sentences.english: The geomantic omen doctrine was very current in North Song dynasty and had much influence on the mausoleum system then.
sentences.chinese: 宋代陰陽堪輿術影響甚盛，陵寢制度深受其影響。

sentences.english: The other part is the mausoleum .
His first stop is Nanjing where the late Sun Yat-sen's tomb is located.
sentences.chinese: 吳伯雄首站抵達南京，這裏是孫中山先生陵寢所在地。

sentences.english: A masterpiece of Gothic style, it is the burial place of the House of Savoy.
sentences.chinese: 它是哥特式的傑作，是薩沃依王室的陵寢之地。

sentences.english: So the emperor mausoleum monument more than a pack of turtles, it is as Anyu basalt.
sentences.chinese: 所以帝王陵寢多有馱碑之龜，正是以此暗寓玄武。

sentences.english: And abducts himself to the beloved catacombs and vaults.
sentences.chinese: 並把他誘拐，帶到親愛的地下陵寢。

definition: to pay homage at a mausoleum
Huanghuagang (Chrysanthemum Hill) in Guangzhou, scene of disastrous uprising of 23rd April 1911
Eastern tombs/Dongling district of Shenyang city 瀋陽市|沈阳市, Liaoning
grave/tomb/graveyard/cemetery/fig. one's native place (where one's ancestors are buried)
Zhang Juzheng (1525-1582), Grand Secretary during the Ming dynasty, credited with bringing the dynasty to its apogee
first Sui emperor (541-604) Yang Jian (541-604), reigned 581-604
model teacher of every age (idiom)/eternal paragon/refers to Confucius (551-479 BC) 孔子[Kong3 zi3]
Prince Shōtoku Taiji (574-621), major Japanese statesman and reformer of the Asuka period 飛鳥時代|飞鸟时代[Fei1 niao3 Shi2 dai4], proponent of state Buddhism, portrayed as Buddhist saint
